head.title: Two Business Groups Considering a Merger

hedline.hl1: Two Business Groups Considering a Merger

abstract.p: Westchester County Chamber of Commerce president Harold Vogt is retiring after 30 years in post; chamber is considering merger with Westchester County Assn; photo (S)

block.p: Harold E. Vogt is retiring after 30 years as president of the Westchester County Chamber of Commerce, and the chamber is considering a merger with the county's other major business advocacy group, the Westchester County Association.
The 96-year-old chamber, with 3,000 member businesses and individuals, oversees the Westchester Small Business Council and training programs and lobbies on behalf of businesses.

Harold E. Vogt is retiring after 30 years as president of the Westchester County Chamber of Commerce, and the chamber is considering a merger with the county's other major business advocacy group, the Westchester County Association.
The 96-year-old chamber, with 3,000 member businesses and individuals, oversees the Westchester Small Business Council and training programs and lobbies on behalf of businesses.
The 50-year-old Westchester County Association, with 700 members, is also a lobbying organization. It works on economic development issues and created a loan program for minority-owned businesses.
